attributes.comment:
The size of the proposed immigration fee increases is troubling and unfair,
particularly if we want to help immigrants become legal U.S. citizens. Charging
$905 (a 178 percent increase) to apply for permanent residency would be an
undue economic hardship for many applicants and their family members. Imagine
what our country would be like today if this same fee structure had been imposed
upon our own ancestors.

I urge USCIS to work with Congress to create an alternative and permanent
funding stream that will support USCIS operations. I also urge Congress to fund
immigration services and policies that benefit families rather than spend millions of
dollars on arrests, detention, and deportation, which cause untold hardships for
families and communities.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Arthur Figel
